meanings.definition: To arrange or direct excessively elaborate musical accompaniment.
meanings.sent1: During the concert, the conductor overorchestrates the music, adding too many instruments.
meanings.sent2: She tends to overorchestrate every piece she conducts, making them sound cluttered.
meanings.sent3: The orchestra members joked that the conductor might overorchestrate so much that they would need a bigger stage.
meanings.sent4: His tendency to overorchestrate the music turns every performance into a chaotic symphony.
meanings.sent5: The conductor's habit of overorchestrating creates a cacophony of sound that overwhelms the audience.

meanings.definition: To plan or coordinate in an overly complex or detailed manner.
meanings.sent1: When organizing the event, she tends to overorchestrate every little detail, causing unnecessary stress.
meanings.sent2: He always overorchestrates his schedule, trying to fit too many tasks into one day.
meanings.sent3: The bridezilla's wedding planner was known to overorchestrate every aspect of the ceremony, down to the smallest flower arrangement.
meanings.sent4: The project manager's attempt to overorchestrate every step of the process only led to confusion among the team members.
meanings.sent5: Her tendency to overorchestrate every decision made the simple task of choosing a restaurant a daunting challenge.
